com.mygdx.game.model

Class EnemyModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mygdx.game.model.ElementModel
      • com.mygdx.game.model.EnemyModel
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BatModel, BubbleModel, SnailModel

    public abstract class EnemyModel
extends ElementModel
    EnemyModel class deals with with the state of the enemy, its health points, its removal flag and its behaviour, updating its position.
    See Also:
    ElementModel

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean damage()
      Decreases the health points by one and, if the health points are equal to 0, return true.
      boolean getFlip()
      Returns the flag flip that informs if the sprite must be flipped.
      boolean getForRemoval()
      Returns the flag flagForRemoval
      int getPoints()
      Return the value in points that result of killing this enemy.
      void setForRemoval()
      Flags the enemy for removal, meaning that on the next verification, this entity will cease to exist.
      float[] update(HeroBody hero)
      Calls the method act of the behaviour of the enemy, saving its result in a array.

      • damage

        public boolean damage()
        Decreases the health points by one and, if the health points are equal to 0, return true. Else returns false.
        Returns:
        true if health points equal to 0, false if not

      • update

        public float[] update(HeroBody hero)
        Calls the method act of the behaviour of the enemy, saving its result in a array. It then returns that array.
        Parameters:
        hero - body of the hero used to make calculations in the act method of the behaviour
        Returns:
        array of the new direction coordinates x and y of the enemy movement

      • getPoints

        public int getPoints()
        Return the value in points that result of killing this enemy.
        Returns:
        points that killing this enemy results in
